Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse and reflect on the influence of values and beliefs on the development of identities
Elaboration: Examining the benefits of accepting and appreciating their unique qualities and strengths in supporting their own and others’ wellbeing (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse and reflect on the influence of values and beliefs on the development of identities
Elaboration: Understanding and acknowledging the impacts of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples going through Sorry Business and the protocols that support the communities (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse and reflect on the influence of values and beliefs on the development of identities
Elaboration: Examining how cultural values and beliefs influence the way young people view themselves, for example Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and Australians of Asian and other heritage (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse and reflect on the influence of values and beliefs on the development of identities
Elaboration: Examining how cultural beliefs about the physical changes experienced during puberty can influence gender, cultural and sexual identities (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse and reflect on the influence of values and beliefs on the development of identities
Elaboration: Investigating strategies to manage the impact of influences on their identities and emotions, and responses to change; for example, seeking social support, practising mindfulness and emotional regulation (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse the impact of changes and transitions, and devise strategies to support themselves and others through these changes
Elaboration: Investigating the changing nature of peer and family relationships and proposing strategies to manage these changes (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse the impact of changes and transitions, and devise strategies to support themselves and others through these changes
Elaboration: Accessing and assessing health information and services that support young people to effectively manage changes and transitions as they grow older, including information about sexually transmitted infections, contraception and safe sexual practices (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse the impact of changes and transitions, and devise strategies to support themselves and others through these changes
Elaboration: Examining how ceremonies of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples involve sharing of cultural knowledge leading to changes in social standing and responsibilities (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse the impact of changes and transitions, and devise strategies to support themselves and others through these changes
Elaboration: Examining the notion of code switching; that is, how Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples live across multiple cultures, and how these transitions can affect a sense of belonging to culture, family and peer groups (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse the impact of changes and transitions, and devise strategies to support themselves and others through these changes
Elaboration: Evaluating and practising coping, communication and problem-solving skills to manage changes and emotions associated with puberty, getting older and transitioning to new environments (such as secondary school) (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse the impact of changes and transitions, and devise strategies to support themselves and others through these changes
Elaboration: Examining the impact of physical, social and emotional changes that occur during periods of transition (most of which are beyond an individual’s control) and discussing the value of positive peer environments in supporting belonging and wellbeing (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine how roles, decision-making, and levels of power, coercion and control within relationships can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Exploring scenarios in texts that demonstrate how gender inequality can arise from intergenerational patterns of inequity and unequal power in relationships (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine how roles, decision-making, and levels of power, coercion and control within relationships can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Examining how gender roles and stereotypes can influence beliefs and decisions about self, friendships, sexual relationships, sexual behaviour, contraceptive use, substance use and future life plans (AD, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine how roles, decision-making, and levels of power, coercion and control within relationships can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Identifying those positive character attributes and strengths that are valued regardless of gender (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine how roles, decision-making, and levels of power, coercion and control within relationships can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Investigating strategies that have been successful in challenging harmful or limiting stereotypes, attitudes or practices (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine how roles, decision-making, and levels of power, coercion and control within relationships can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Exploring texts that demonstrate the impact of stigmatising language, such as negative labels, stereotypes and judgement, on the health and wellbeing of affected people (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine the roles of respect, empathy, power and coercion in developing respectful relationships
Elaboration: Analysing how their behaviours, actions and responses to situations can change depending on whether they are by themselves, with friends or with family (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine the roles of respect, empathy, power and coercion in developing respectful relationships
Elaboration: Recognising the impact bullying and harassment can have on relationships, including online relationships (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine the roles of respect, empathy, power and coercion in developing respectful relationships
Elaboration: Showing respect for cultural norms and sensitivities when building relationships with people from different cultural backgrounds (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine the roles of respect, empathy, power and coercion in developing respectful relationships
Elaboration: Proposing strategies for addressing racism towards people of different cultural backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, and examining the role of upstanders in promoting respectful interactions and challenging disrespect and discrimination (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine the roles of respect, empathy, power and coercion in developing respectful relationships
Elaboration: Examining what constitutes disrespectful, harmful or violent behaviour within peer, family and intimate relationships (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Examine the roles of respect, empathy, power and coercion in developing respectful relationships
Elaboration: Understanding and applying online and social protocols to enhance relationships with others and protect their own wellbeing, including recognising and responding to inappropriate online content (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Investigating how respecting diversity and challenging racism, sexism, ableism and homophobia influence individual and community health and wellbeing (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Examining values and beliefs about cultural and social issues such as gender, race, violence, sexuality, body image and ability, and examining how resisting stereotypes can empower individuals to be themselves (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Developing strategies to challenge prejudicial views of gender, race, violence, sexual diversity, gender diversity, body image and ability to contribute to inclusive communities (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Researching how norms, stereotypes and prejudice are challenged in local, national and global contexts (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Investigating events and strategies that value the contributions of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, such as Indigenous rounds in sporting codes and NAIDOC Week (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate strategies that influence how communities value diversity and propose actions they can take to promote inclusion in their communities
Elaboration: Identifying examples of beliefs and cultural practices within, between and across cultural groups, including cultural groups from the Asian region, and describing how they have changed or remained the same over time (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse factors that influence emotional responses and devise strategies to self-manage emotions
Elaboration: Investigating personal, social and cultural factors that influence the way individuals respond emotionally to different situations and determining the impact these responses could have on others (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse factors that influence emotional responses and devise strategies to self-manage emotions
Elaboration: Exploring different viewpoints, practising being empathetic and considering alternative ways to respond in a variety of situations, taking into account how these responses may affect others (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse factors that influence emotional responses and devise strategies to self-manage emotions
Elaboration: Recognising and interpreting emotional responses to stressful situations and proposing strategies to ensure those responses don’t have a negative impact on their relationships with others (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply skills and strategies to communicate assertively and respectfully when seeking, giving or denying consent across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Exploring and refining skills and strategies needed to communicate assertively and respectfully in relationships (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply skills and strategies to communicate assertively and respectfully when seeking, giving or denying consent across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Understanding and applying online protocols to enhance relationships with others (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply skills and strategies to communicate assertively and respectfully when seeking, giving or denying consent across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Protecting their own physical and emotional wellbeing, including recognising and responding to online content that may be harmful to themselves or others (such as grooming or image-based abuse) and respectfully communicating needs and concerns to a trusted adult (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply skills and strategies to communicate assertively and respectfully when seeking, giving or denying consent across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Examining the nature of consent in different types of relationships, and proposing and practising strategies for seeking, giving and denying consent respectfully (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply skills and strategies to communicate assertively and respectfully when seeking, giving or denying consent across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Rehearsing decision-making strategies they could use when giving or denying consent in different situations; for example, identifying the problem, planning to solve the problem and putting the solution into action (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others (including basic first aid and CPR)
Elaboration: Exploring different strategies they can use, and resources or help sites they can access or refer others to, if they are experiencing symptoms of anxiety or depression (MH, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others (including basic first aid and CPR)
Elaboration: Examining scenarios to highlight how emotions, dispositions, social supports, and gender and cultural norms can affect a person’s willingness to seek help (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others (including basic first aid and CPR)
Elaboration: Exploring strategies for dealing with online abuse and bullying when there is an imbalance of power, such as grooming, image-based abuse or negative social interactions, and reporting the situation to appropriate authorities, trusted adults and through online tools (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others (including basic first aid and CPR)
Elaboration: Analysing how upstanders play a role in ensuring online spaces are positive and safe, and examining how support services such as Kids Helpline and the eSafety Commissioner can provide support for young people who feel unsafe, bullied or abused online (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others (including basic first aid and CPR)
Elaboration: Exploring help-seeking scenarios young people may encounter and sharing strategies for dealing with each situation, including situations linked to substance use (such as alcohol, cigarettes, e-cigarettes, cannabis or inhalants), mental health issues, safety and risk-taking, and sexual health (AD, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine protective behaviours and evaluate community resources to seek help for themselves and others (including basic first aid and CPR)
Elaboration: Exploring basic first-aid principles and practising strategies to assist others in an emergency situation, such as DRSABCD and RICER (S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how media and influential people in the community impact attitudes, beliefs, decisions and behaviours in relation to health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Analysing the credibility, validity and relevance of health messages conveyed by different sources (including news sites, bloggers, influencers and social media advertising) and applying credible information to health-related decisions (AD, FN, HBPA, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how media and influential people in the community impact attitudes, beliefs, decisions and behaviours in relation to health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Investigating how messages related to food are portrayed in the media and how this may impact decision-making in relation to health and wellbeing (FN)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how media and influential people in the community impact attitudes, beliefs, decisions and behaviours in relation to health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Exploring and evaluating the accessibility and reliability of health information in the media that targets young people in relation to their health, wellbeing, body, sexuality, relationships and other health issues (AD, FN, HBPA, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how media and influential people in the community impact attitudes, beliefs, decisions and behaviours in relation to health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Investigating community health campaigns targeting young people (including those targeting Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples) and developing a school or community action plan to raise awareness and support for a chosen campaign (AD, FN, HBPA, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how media and influential people in the community impact attitudes, beliefs, decisions and behaviours in relation to health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Analysing how messages related to bodies and appearance and sexual relationships are portrayed in different forms of media and how they may influence the way people feel about themselves and the way they act within relationships (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Researching health information and messaging to recognise credible sources of information, for example government organisations, the Royal Children’s Hospital and Beyond Blue (AD, FN, HBPA, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Investigating the recommendations made in the Australian Guide to Healthy Eating, the nutritional value of food, value for money and sustainability, and producing a guide to help students make choices when buying food from the school canteen and preparing snack and lunch options (FN)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Researching community messages and programs designed to promote safety, health and wellbeing in the community, such as road safety, safe use of public transport, water safety, food choices, education about e-cigarettes and gaming, and taking action to promote increased awareness of these programs in their community (AD, FN, HBPA, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Examining how different cultures value the contribution of the mind–body–spirit connection to health and wellbeing, for example Dadirri (the Aboriginal meditative practice of deep listening developed and shared by the Aboriginal Peoples of the Daly River region) and yoga and meditation practices from the Asia region (HBPA, MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Investigating preventive health strategies relevant to young people, and designing and implementing health promotion activities that raise awareness of these strategies (AD, FN, HBPA, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Plan and implement strategies, using health resources, to enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing
Elaboration: Investigating different approaches and developing personal plans for promoting their own positive mental health and wellbeing, such as mindfulness, relaxation techniques, using ‘do not disturb’ mode or turning off notifications on online devices, regular physical activity and increasing vegetable intake (FN, HBPA, MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine and transfer movement skills in a variety of movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Analysing their own and/or others’ performance using digital tools and implementing feedback to enhance performance of movement skills, including fundamental movement skills if required (CA, FMS, GS, LLPA, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine and transfer movement skills in a variety of movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Transferring fielding skills from similar games when playing traditional and non-traditional sports and activities (AP, FMS, GS, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine and transfer movement skills in a variety of movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Refining passing and receiving skills in a game involving increased defensive pressure (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine and transfer movement skills in a variety of movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Using feedback from teammates in a game to know when to travel, mark or intercept to achieve and retain possession (FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Refine and transfer movement skills in a variety of movement situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Refining a range of swimming strokes using feedback from a teacher, peer or video resources (FMS, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and demonstrate how movement strategies can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Developing and implementing appropriate strategies for selected movement scenarios (CA, GS, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and demonstrate how movement strategies can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Selecting strategies that have been successful previously and applying the most appropriate ones when solving new movement challenges (AP, CA, GS, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and demonstrate how movement strategies can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Designing a new attacking and/or defensive strategy during minor or modified games (AP, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and demonstrate how movement strategies can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Predicting the effectiveness of changes in tactics or strategies on scoring opportunities (AP, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and demonstrate how movement strategies can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Examining and demonstrating the similarities of strategies used in different physical activities and how they can be transferred to new movement situations (AP, CA, GS, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Demonstrate and explain how movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Performing a range of movements and analysing technique based on understanding of effort in relation to take-off, body position and landing (FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Demonstrate and explain how movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Demonstrating an understanding of how to adjust the angle of release of an object and how this will affect the height and distance of flight (FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Demonstrate and explain how movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Designing and refining performances to demonstrate how to manipulate space and relationships between players in the space to achieve successful movement outcomes (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Demonstrate and explain how movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be manipulated to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Adjusting the timing of movement when performing skills in new movement situations such as striking a pitched ball rather than a stationary ball, or timing of rhythmic movement to music (AP, FMS, GS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Adapt and perform movement sequences in a variety of contexts, demonstrating how the movement elements of time, effort, space, people and objects can enhance performance
Elaboration: Using feedback from others to refine the composition of a group movement sequence in response to music or other stimuli (FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Adapt and perform movement sequences in a variety of contexts, demonstrating how the movement elements of time, effort, space, people and objects can enhance performance
Elaboration: Performing rhythmic movement sequences that demonstrate variations in flow of movements, use of space and relationships to other performers (FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Adapt and perform movement sequences in a variety of contexts, demonstrating how the movement elements of time, effort, space, people and objects can enhance performance
Elaboration: Creating and performing different movement sequences requiring static and dynamic balance, demonstrating transition between the bases of support and flow of movements (FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Adapt and perform movement sequences in a variety of contexts, demonstrating how the movement elements of time, effort, space, people and objects can enhance performance
Elaboration: Performing movement sequences to safely and efficiently travel around, over, up, under and through obstacles in an outdoor environment or built obstacles (CA, FMS, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Adapt and perform movement sequences in a variety of contexts, demonstrating how the movement elements of time, effort, space, people and objects can enhance performance
Elaboration: Using feedback from a peer coach to adapt movement sequences to create, use and defend space in invasion, net/court, striking and fielding, and target games (FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Adapt and perform movement sequences in a variety of contexts, demonstrating how the movement elements of time, effort, space, people and objects can enhance performance
Elaboration: Adapt and combine previously learned skills to perform more complex athletic skills such as those for triple jump, high jump and javelin, demonstrating the elements of movement (FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities designed to improve fitness to investigate the impact of regular participation on health and wellbeing
Elaboration: Using digital tools to design and monitor personal physical activity programs that support regular participation and meet their individual health, wellbeing and fitness goals (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities designed to improve fitness to investigate the impact of regular participation on health and wellbeing
Elaboration: Participating in a fitness circuit that could be implemented at home (with minimal equipment) that improves fitness goals (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities designed to improve fitness to investigate the impact of regular participation on health and wellbeing
Elaboration: Researching and participating in new activities, such as yoga, Pilates, mindfulness meditation, gym classes or HIIT sessions, to explore how these can enhance health, fitness and wellbeing, and evaluate which is best suited to their individual needs (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities designed to improve fitness to investigate the impact of regular participation on health and wellbeing
Elaboration: Creating a personal physical activity plan designed to improve or maintain components of fitness (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities designed to improve fitness to investigate the impact of regular participation on health and wellbeing
Elaboration: Participating in a range of physical activities and evaluating individual acute responses such as heart rate, breathing rate, ability to talk and recovery rate (GS, HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities that utilise community spaces, outdoor environments and aquatic settings safely, and evaluate strategies to support the increased use of these spaces
Elaboration: Evaluating different strategies used to manage and protect environments where physical activities take place, such as bushwalking trails, surf beaches, skate parks and sporting fields (CA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities that utilise community spaces, outdoor environments and aquatic settings safely, and evaluate strategies to support the increased use of these spaces
Elaboration: Designing and evaluating physical activity options that reimagine the use of community spaces to encourage more active lifestyles among their peer group (CA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities that utilise community spaces, outdoor environments and aquatic settings safely, and evaluate strategies to support the increased use of these spaces
Elaboration: Promoting an understanding of minimal-impact recreation in the local area while investigating different approaches to custodial responsibility for Country and Place used by Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ communities (CA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities that utilise community spaces, outdoor environments and aquatic settings safely, and evaluate strategies to support the increased use of these spaces
Elaboration: Exploring the variety of physical activity options available at community sporting facilities such as parks and leisure centres, and evaluating strategies used to promote safe and inclusive participation within the community, such as across different age groups (LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and justify a physical activity plan that incorporates strategies to increase physical activity levels to achieve health and wellbeing outcomes
Elaboration: Designing and monitoring a personal physical activity plan that proposes realistic strategies for increasing physical activity levels and reducing sedentary behaviours (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and justify a physical activity plan that incorporates strategies to increase physical activity levels to achieve health and wellbeing outcomes
Elaboration: Investigating which physical activities people engage in to maintain emotional and social wellbeing, and designing a program of activities aimed at increasing social connection and wellbeing (HBPA, LLPA, MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and justify a physical activity plan that incorporates strategies to increase physical activity levels to achieve health and wellbeing outcomes
Elaboration: Comparing their current physical activity levels, amount of sleep and sedentary activity time with the Australian 24-Hour Movement Guidelines for Children and Young People and suggesting strategies for themselves and others to meet these recommendations (HBPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and justify a physical activity plan that incorporates strategies to increase physical activity levels to achieve health and wellbeing outcomes
Elaboration: Creating a personal plan designed to improve or maintain health-related fitness (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Design and justify a physical activity plan that incorporates strategies to increase physical activity levels to achieve health and wellbeing outcomes
Elaboration: Participating in a personal daily physical activity program, and evaluating the impact participation has on their mood and mental wellbeing (HBPA, LLPA, MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Propose, test and evaluate movement strategies and skills that would be most effective in different movement situations
Elaboration: Evaluating factors that enabled them to achieve success in movement activities and justifying how these factors can be transferred to other learning contexts (CA, GS, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Propose, test and evaluate movement strategies and skills that would be most effective in different movement situations
Elaboration: Explaining and justifying the movement strategies selected in response to movement challenges when participating in outdoor activities such as rope courses, bushwalking, orienteering or canoeing (CA, GS, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Propose, test and evaluate movement strategies and skills that would be most effective in different movement situations
Elaboration: Putting their movement solutions into action by predicting outcomes and testing the approach proposed to achieve successful movement outcomes (CA, GS, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse modifications to equipment, rules and scoring systems that support fair play and inclusive participation
Elaboration: Trialling and modifying rules, equipment or scoring systems to improve enjoyment, inclusion and success in physical activities (FMS, GS, HBPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse modifications to equipment, rules and scoring systems that support fair play and inclusive participation
Elaboration: Analysing the benefits and potential drawbacks of activities where players, rather than an independent official, are responsible for officiating the game (FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse modifications to equipment, rules and scoring systems that support fair play and inclusive participation
Elaboration: Examining rules, equipment and scoring systems of traditional games of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples and investigating how these support skill development and fair and inclusive play (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and apply leadership, collaboration and group decision-making processes when participating in a range of physical activities
Elaboration: Undertaking various roles as a leader or collaborator to support the planning of physical activities for their team or peer group (CA, FMS, GS, LLPA, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and apply leadership, collaboration and group decision-making processes when participating in a range of physical activities
Elaboration: Adopting roles and responsibilities that support and enhance team cohesion and lead to successful movement outcomes (CA, GS, LLPA, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and apply leadership, collaboration and group decision-making processes when participating in a range of physical activities
Elaboration: Applying an understanding of verbal, physical and situational cues to identify and respond appropriately to the feelings and motives of others when working in a team or group (AP, CA, GS, LLPA, RE, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Practise and apply leadership, collaboration and group decision-making processes when participating in a range of physical activities
Elaboration: Reflecting on their role in a team or group and articulating how the actions they initiated in that role led to the achievement of various outcomes (AP, CA, GS, LLPA, RE)
